name: AccessToken
title: AccessTokens
description: Access tokens are credentials used to access protected resources.

fields.name: access_token
fields.title: Access Token
fields.description: An  access token is a string representing an authorization issued to the client.

fields.name: client_id
fields.title: Client ID
fields.description: The authorization server issues the registered client a client identifier -- a unique string representing the registration information provided by the client.

fields.name: user_id
fields.title: User ID
fields.description: An alphanumeric sequence of characters which represents the identifier of a user (an email address or user name etc).
The expiration date and time of this access token.
fields.name: expires
fields.title: Expires

fields.name: refresh_token
fields.title: Refresh Token
fields.description: Refresh tokens are issued to the client by the authorization server and are used to obtain a new access token when the current access token becomes invalid or expires.

fields.name: scope
fields.title: Scope
fields.description: Scope is used to limit the authorization granted to the client by the resource owner.
